question.title: Elasticsearch Datetime Mapping for localized zone-offset in Brackets
question.body:
I have an index in Elasticsearch that needs to take datetime formats in the following variations:

08/23/2023 8:00:00 PM(UTC+0)
2023-08-23T20:00:00+0000

I can't get an Elasticsearch mapping for the first one with the UTC in brackets, I've tried: MM/dd/yyyy K:mm:ss a'('O')' which I thought would work according to the docs - https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatter.html

I did get an Elasticsearch mapping that works, but it wouldn't work if there was an offset in the brackets.

{
  "mappings": {
    "properties": {
      "date": {
        "type":   "date",
        "format": "date_optional_time||MM/dd/yyyy K:mm:ss a'(UTC+0)'"
      }
    }
  }
}

Any help would be massively appreciated
